sn54.20:4.1: “Mendicants, when samādhi due to mindfulness of breathing is developed and cultivated it leads to the ending of defilements.
sn54.20:4.3: And how is samādhi due to mindfulness of breathing developed and cultivated so as to lead to giving up the fetters,
sn54.20:4.5: completely understanding the course of time,
sn54.20:4.7: It’s when a mendicant—gone to a wilderness, or to the root of a tree, or to an empty hut—sits down in the meditation posture, with their body erect, and focuses their mindfulness right there. …
sn54.20:4.8: They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe in observing letting go.’ They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe out observing letting go.’
sn54.20:4.9: That’s how samādhi due to mindfulness of breathing is developed and cultivated so as to lead to giving up the fetters,
sn54.20:4.11: completely understanding the course of time,
sn54.20:8.1: The Linked Discourses on Mindfulness of Breathing is the tenth section.
